Primitive Class Reference
[Graphics rendering library]

#include <Primitive.h>

Inheritance diagram for Primitive:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Geometry primitive list.


Public Types

enum  { MAX_BONES = 255 }
enum  PrimType {
  PRIM_POINT = 0, PRIM_LINE = 1, PRIM_LINESTRIP = 2, PRIM_TRI = 3,
  PRIM_TRISTRIP = 4, PRIM_TRIFAN = 5, PRIM_SPRITE = 6, PRIM_INVALID = 7
}
 Geometry primitive type.

virtual void Primitive::getIndexDataPtr ( uint16_t **  data,
int *  indexsize 
) [pure virtual]

Returns pointer to face index data.

Primitive needs to be locked before calling this method. WARNING: Low level operation, better to use getIndices etc. methods.

virtual void Primitive::packBones (  )  [pure virtual]

Optimizes bone list so that the bones used by this primitive are numbered from 0 (inclusive) to n (exclusive), where n is total number bones used by this primitive.

usedBoneArray return list of actual skin mesh bone indices. Primitive needs to be locked for writing before calling this method.

See also:
NS(ContextObject,Lock)

usedBoneArray

usedBones

virtual void Primitive::setIndexData ( int  v0,
const void *  data,
int  indexsize,
int  count 
) [pure virtual]

Sets vertex indices.

Supports format conversion. Primitive needs to be locked for writing before calling this method.

Parameters:
v0 First vertex index to set.
data Pointer to source data.
indexsize Byte size of single index (1,2 or 4).
count Number of indices to set.

virtual void Primitive::setIndexRangeBegin ( int  begin  )  [pure virtual]

Sets range of indices used in rendering.

Range must be below maximum index count specified in object creation. Range specifies the first index used to render the primitive.

virtual void Primitive::setIndexRangeEnd ( int  end  )  [pure virtual]

Sets range of indices used in rendering.

Range must be below or equal to maximum index count specified in object creation. Range specifies one beyond the last index used to render the primitive.

virtual void Primitive::setPerspectiveCorrection ( int  quality  )  [virtual]

Sets perspective correction quality level to be used while rending this primitive.

Parameters:
quality Perspective correction quality in range 0-10, 0=off, 10=best.

virtual void Primitive::setShader ( Shader *  fx  )  [pure virtual]

Sets shader to be used while rendering the primitive.

Rendering sequence:

  1. First call NS(Shader,begin)() for the shader before rendering any geometry
  2. Set shader parameters which need to be updated every frame, like transforms.
  3. Call NS(Shader,beginPass)(0) to start rendering geometry using the first pass of the shader.
  4. Call render() for each primitive to be rendered.
  5. Call NS(Shader,endPass)() to stop rendering using this pass of the shader.
  6. Loop to NS(Shader,beginPass)(i) for other passes, as many times as return value of begin() specified.
  7. End rendering by calling NS(Shader,end)() for the shader.

virtual void Primitive::setUsedBones ( const uint8_t *  usedbonearray,
int  usedbones 
) [pure virtual]

Sets list of bones used by this primitive.

List contains indices numbered from 0 (inclusive) to n (exclusive), where n is total number bones used by this primitive. usedBoneArray return lists of actual skin mesh bone indices. Primitive needs to be locked for writing before calling this method.

See also:
NS(ContextObject,Lock)

usedBoneArray

usedBones

virtual void Primitive::setVertexBoneIndices ( int  index,
const NS(math, float4)*  data,
int  count 
) [pure virtual]

Sets vertex bone blending indices used in skinning.

Primitive needs to be locked for writing before calling this method. Works only with float valued vertex data. Use getVertexDataPtr to access compressed data.

See also:
NS(ContextObject,Lock)
Parameters:
index First vertex to set.
data Normal coordinate data.
count Normal coordinate count.

virtual void Primitive::setVertexPositionScaleBias ( const NS(math, float4)&  scalebias  )  [pure virtual]

Sets scale & bias for unpacking vertex data.

Parameters:
scalebias scale=x, bias=yzw v(1) = v(0) * scale + bias

virtual void Primitive::setWireframeColor ( int  color  )  [virtual]

Sets wireframe rendering color of the model as specified RGB888 color.

Wireframe color is used when debug mode NS(Context,setWireframeEnabled) is true.

virtual const uint8_t* Primitive::usedBoneArray (  )  const [pure virtual]

Returns array of bones used by this primitive.

Indices returned by this function represent skin mesh bone indices. Beware that changing skin mesh might invalidate the indices returned by the primitive, unless primitive is updated accordingly. List returned by this method is guaranteed to be valid only as long as any other method of this primitive is not called.
